item.title: Hazelemere Rd - no-car zone, 28th August
item.description:
Enormous dumping in last 24h! Fridge, mattress, suitcase, multiple black bags, other rubbish. Shame on whoever does this and shame on Brent Council for not nipping this recurring issue in the bud long ago. This didnâ€™t happen before bollards were knocked down!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hazelmere Road, London

item.title: Nationalist flags hung up on lampposts all along Chipperfield Road near the railway station intended to intimidate people legally seeking asylum, 28th August
item.description:
About 20 nationalistic flags have been hung up all along Chipperfield Road and the surrounding roads near St Mary Cray station, intended to intimidate people legally seeking asylum.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chipperfield Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven road, 28th August
item.description:
The main Upper Holloway road between St Johns Villas and Windermere road is very uneven and causing vibrations and trembling in nearby homes whenever vehicles pass by which is causing anxiety and mental anguish for me as a resident who suffers with anxiety, please tarmac the road or do whatever is necessary to make the road more even as to stop the vibrations

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Elthorne Road, Archway, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Rubbish Accumulation Along East Rochester Way/A2, 28th August
item.description:
Iâ€™m writing this at 6:30 AM on a Thursday morning, and I wish I could say the early hour brought some peaceâ€”but instead, Iâ€™m met with a deeply disappointing sight. Both sides of East Rochester Way/A2 are absolutely covered in rubbish. Itâ€™s everywhere. Bags, bottles, wrappersâ€”strewn across the verges and pavements in a way thatâ€™s not just unsightly, but frankly disgusting. Itâ€™s hard to believe such a major road has been left in this state for so long. The sheer volume of waste suggests this isnâ€™t a one-off issueâ€”itâ€™s been neglected, and it shows. I urge you to take immediate action to clean up the area and put measures in place to prevent this from continuing. This is not the image our community should project. Please treat this with the urgency it deserves. Kind regards Lukasz Manka
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
